}} The '1984 UEFA European Football Championship' final tournament was held in
France. West Germany also bid for the hosting of this event. Dietrich Schulze-
Marmeling: Die Geschichte der FuÃball-Europameisterschaft, Verlag Die Werkstatt,
ISBN 978-3-89533-553-2 It was the seventh European Football Championship,
a competition held every four years and endorsed by UEFA. The final tournament
took place from 12 to 27 June 1984.

At the time, only eight countries took part in the final stage of the
tournament, seven of which had to come through the qualifying stage. France
qualified automatically as hosts of the event; led by Michel Platini, who scored
nine goals in France's five matches, Les Bleus won the tournament â their first
major international title.
